tool.name: CalculateCompositeScenicInventoryRanking

param.name: viewpointSource
param.dialogReference:
Source viewpoint table from the Enjoy the View master database.

Use Database Connections\ETV_on_INP2300VIRMASQL_ETV_Reader.sde\ETV.web.ViewBearings
param.pythonReference:
Source viewpoint table from the Enjoy the View master database.

Use Database Connections\ETV_on_INP2300VIRMASQL_ETV_Reader.sde\ETV.web.ViewBearings

param.name: parkToExtract
param.dialogReference: Park unit code derived from Viewpoint source table.
param.pythonReference: Park unit code derived from Viewpoint source table.

param.name: outDB
param.dialogReference: Output geodatabase (file geodatabase). Must contain visible area feature classes produced by the Create Viewsheds and Visible Areas tool.
param.pythonReference: Output geodatabase (file geodatabase). Must contain visible area feature classes produced by the Create Viewsheds and Visible Areas tool.

tool.summary:
Given visible area polygons produced by the Create Viewsheds and Visible Areas tool, calculate the composite scenic inventory value and rank from a union of the visible areas polygons. The tool iterates through the selected park’s visible areas feature classes in the output geodatabase. Due to the attribute cleanup required after composite calculations, this tool may take an hour or more to run if more than 15 viewpoints (visible areas) are used as inputs.

Note: composite scenic inventory feature classes will not be created if view importance is missing from the Enjoy the View database.

Tool output:

  • Visible areas (by observer point) with composite scenic inventory value, ranking, and view count

dataIdInfo.idAbs:

The tool iterates through the selected park’s visible areas feature classes in the output geodatabase. Due to the attribute cleanup required after composite calculations, this tool may take an hour or more to run if more than 15 viewpoints (visible areas) are used as inputs.

Note: composite scenic inventory feature classes will not be created if view importance is missing from the Enjoy the View database.

Tool output:

  • Visible areas (by observer point) with composite scenic inventory value, ranking, and view count
dataIdInfo.idCredit: NPS Scenic Quality Inventory, NPS Air Resources Division
